messages.content:
Experiment Plan: Gender Differences in Academic Performance

Explore the differences in academic performance, as measured by 'PERCENTILE IN CLASS', between male and female respondents. This analysis will involve comparing the distribution of class percentiles between genders using statistical tests such as t-tests or ANOVA. Visualizations like box plots or violin plots can be used to illustrate the differences in distributions. The goal is to identify whether there are significant gender-based differences in academic performance and to what extent they exist.
messages.name: user_proxy

messages.content: {"hypothesis":"There is a significant difference in academic performance, as measured by percentile in class, between male and female respondents.","dimensions":{"contexts":["Participants of the NLS dataset","Secondary school graduates"],"variables":["Gender","Percentile in Class"],"relationships":[{"explanatory":"Gender","response":"Percentile in Class","relationship":"significant difference"}]}}
messages.name: hypothesis_generator

messages.content:
{"code":"from scipy.stats import ttest_ind

# Separate the data by gender
male_percentiles = df[df['SAMPLE_SEX'] == 'Male']['PERCENTILE IN CLASS']
female_percentiles = df[df['SAMPLE_SEX'] == 'Female']['PERCENTILE IN CLASS']

# Perform a t-test to compare the means of the two groups
t_stat, p_value = ttest_ind(male_percentiles, female_percentiles)

# Print the t-statistic and p-value
print(f"T-statistic: {t_stat}")
print(f"P-value: {p_value}")

# Visualize the differences using box plots
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
sns.boxplot(x='SAMPLE_SEX', y='PERCENTILE IN CLASS', data=df)
plt.title('Box Plot of Percentile in Class by Gender')
plt.xlabel('Gender')
plt.ylabel('Percentile in Class')
plt.show()

# Visualize the differences using violin plots
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
sns.violinplot(x='SAMPLE_SEX', y='PERCENTILE IN CLASS', data=df)
plt.title('Violin Plot of Percentile in Class by Gender')
plt.xlabel('Gender')
plt.ylabel('Percentile in Class')
plt.show()"}

messages.content:
{"error":false,"analysis":"The analysis explored gender differences in academic performance, as measured by 'PERCENTILE IN CLASS'. A t-test was conducted to compare the means of class percentiles between male and female respondents, resulting in a t-statistic of -11.41 and a p-value of approximately 6.07e-30. This indicates a statistically significant difference in academic performance between genders.

The box plot shows that the median percentile for females is slightly higher than for males, with females having a median around 50 and males slightly below 50. The interquartile range (IQR) for females is larger, indicating more variability in their performance compared to males.

The violin plot further illustrates the distribution of class percentiles, showing that both genders have similar distributions, but with a slightly wider spread for females at the lower percentiles. This suggests that while there is a significant difference in median performance, the overall distribution of performance is similar between genders.

Overall, the analysis suggests that female students tend to have a slightly higher median percentile in class compared to male students, although there is more variability in their performance. Despite the statistical significance, the practical difference in performance between genders appears to be small, with both genders showing similar overall distributions."}
messages.name: experiment_analyst

messages.content: {"success":true,"feedback":"The experiment was successful in identifying gender differences in academic performance. The statistical analysis revealed a significant difference in class percentiles between male and female students, with females having a slightly higher median percentile. The visualizations effectively illustrated these differences, showing more variability among female students. While the statistical significance is clear, the practical implications are modest, as both genders exhibit similar overall performance distributions. The experiment met its objective of exploring gender-based differences in academic performance."}

messages.content:
{"code":"from scipy.stats import ttest_ind

# Separate the data by gender
male_percentiles = df[df['SAMPLE_SEX'] == 'Male']['PERCENTILE IN CLASS']
female_percentiles = df[df['SAMPLE_SEX'] == 'Female']['PERCENTILE IN CLASS']

# Perform a t-test to compare the means of the two groups
t_stat, p_value = ttest_ind(male_percentiles, female_percentiles)

# Print the t-statistic and p-value
print(f"T-statistic: {t_stat}")
print(f"P-value: {p_value}")

# Visualize the differences using box plots
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
sns.boxplot(x='SAMPLE_SEX', y='PERCENTILE IN CLASS', data=df)
plt.title('Box Plot of Percentile in Class by Gender')
plt.xlabel('Gender')
plt.ylabel('Percentile in Class')
plt.show()

# Visualize the differences using violin plots
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
sns.violinplot(x='SAMPLE_SEX', y='PERCENTILE IN CLASS', data=df)
plt.title('Violin Plot of Percentile in Class by Gender')
plt.xlabel('Gender')
plt.ylabel('Percentile in Class')
plt.show()"}

messages.content:
{"code":"from scipy.stats import ttest_ind

# Separate the data by gender
male_percentiles = df[df['SAMPLE_SEX'] == 'Male']['PERCENTILE IN CLASS']
female_percentiles = df[df['SAMPLE_SEX'] == 'Female']['PERCENTILE IN CLASS']

# Perform a t-test to compare the means of the two groups
t_stat, p_value = ttest_ind(male_percentiles, female_percentiles)

# Print the t-statistic and p-value
print(f"T-statistic: {t_stat}")
print(f"P-value: {p_value}")

# Visualize the differences using box plots
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
sns.boxplot(x='SAMPLE_SEX', y='PERCENTILE IN CLASS', data=df)
plt.title('Box Plot of Percentile in Class by Gender')
plt.xlabel('Gender')
plt.ylabel('Percentile in Class')
plt.show()

# Visualize the differences using violin plots
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
sns.violinplot(x='SAMPLE_SEX', y='PERCENTILE IN CLASS', data=df)
plt.title('Violin Plot of Percentile in Class by Gender')
plt.xlabel('Gender')
plt.ylabel('Percentile in Class')
plt.show()"}

A t-test was conducted to compare the means of class percentiles between male and female respondents, resulting in a t-statistic of -11.41 and a p-value of approximately 6.07e-30. This indicates a statistically significant difference in academic performance between genders.

The box plot shows that the median percentile for females is slightly higher than for males, with females having a median around 50 and males slightly below 50. The interquartile range (IQR) for females is larger, indicating more variability in their performance compared to males.

The violin plot further illustrates the distribution of class percentiles, showing that both genders have similar distributions, but with a slightly wider spread for females at the lower percentiles. This suggests that while there is a significant difference in median performance, the overall distribution of performance is similar between genders.

Overall, the analysis suggests that female students tend to have a slightly higher median percentile in class compared to male students, although there is more variability in their performance. Despite the statistical significance, the practical difference in performance between genders appears to be small, with both genders showing similar overall distributions."}

The statistical analysis revealed a significant difference in class percentiles between male and female students, with females having a slightly higher median percentile. The visualizations effectively illustrated these differences, showing more variability among female students. While the statistical significance is clear, the practical implications are modest, as both genders exhibit similar overall performance distributions. The experiment met its objective of exploring gender-based differences in academic performance."}
